citation.article-title: Ferribacterium limneticum, gen. nov., sp. nov., an Fe(III)-reducing microorganism isolated from mining-impacted freshwater lake sediments.

p.s: Ferribacterium (Fer'ri.bac.te'ri.um L. neut. n. ferrum, iron; Gr. neut. n. bacterion, a small rod; M.L. neut. n. Ferribacterium, rod-shaped iron bacterium)
Straight or slightly curved rod-shaped cells, 1.4–2.0 μm by 0.3–0.5 μm, motile, without spores.
Cells occur singly or in short chains of 2–4 cells.
Strictly anaerobic chemoorganotroph that oxidizes organic acids with Fe(III) as electron acceptor.
Hydrogen and alcohols are not used as electron donors.
Acetate oxidation is also coupled to nitrate or fumarate reduction.
Fermentation of glucose or citrate was not observed.
Cells contain c-type cytochromes and accumulate PHB granules.
